intro: Nauclea peduncularis, commonly known as the African coffee tree, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that turn from green to red as they mature. Nauclea peduncularis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks. It has traditional medicinal uses in some African communities.
